description: The Z7 file uses a programming language called the Zork Implementation Language (Zork was Infocom's first game). All of the Z-code file extensions use a numerical value for the different Z-machine versions that are used to run them. Examples include the .Z1 , .Z2 , .Z3 , .Z4 , .Z5 , .Z6 , and .Z8 extensions.
NOTE: Along with Z4 and Z6 files, Z7 file extensions are rarely used.
